member.name: T:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC
member.summary: The TEXTMETRIC structure contains basic information about a physical font. All sizes are specified in logical units; that is, they depend on the current mapping mode of the display context.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height (ascent + descent) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Ascent
member.summary: Specifies the ascent (units above the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Descent
member.summary: Specifies the descent (units below the base line) of characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.InternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of leading (space) inside the bounds set by the tmHeight member. Accent marks and other diacritical characters may occur in this area. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.ExternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of extra leading (space) that the application adds between rows. Since this area is outside the font, it contains no marks and is not altered by text output calls in either OPAQUE or TRANSPARENT mode. The designer may set this member to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.AveCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the average width of characters in the font (generally defined as the width of the letter x). This value does not include the overhang required for bold or italic characters.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.MaxCharWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the widest character in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Weight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Overhang
member.summary: Specifies the extra width per string that may be added to some synthesized fonts. When synthesizing some attributes, such as bold or italic, graphics device interface (GDI) or a device may have to add width to a string on both a per-character and per-string basis.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.DigitizedAspectX
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal aspect of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.DigitizedAspectY
member.summary: Specifies the vertical aspect of the device for which the font was designed. The ratio of the tmDigitizedAspectX and tmDigitizedAspectY members is the aspect ratio of the device for which the font was designed.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.FirstChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the first character defined in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.LastChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the last character defined in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.DefaultChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character to be substituted for characters not in the font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.BreakChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character that will be used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Italic
member.summary: Specifies an italic font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.Underlined
member.summary: Specifies an underlined font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.StruckOut
member.summary: Specifies a strikeout font if it is nonzero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.PitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies information about the pitch, the technology, and the family of a physical font.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.TEXTMETRIC.CharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set of the font. The character set can be one of the following values.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS
member.summary: Defines animation parameters for the BP_PAINTPARAMS structure used by BeginBufferedPaint

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS.CBSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS.DWFlags
member.summary: Flag that describes the characteristics of the animation. The following value is the only one currently defined. BPAF_NONCLIENT Indicates that the device context (DC) is a window DC instead of a client DC, so that painting is allowed in the non-client area of the window.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS.Style
member.summary: A member of the BP_ANIMATIONSTYLE enumeration that states animation options.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_ANIMATIONPARAMS.DWDuration
member.summary: Length of the animation, in milliseconds.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_PAINTPARAMS
member.summary: Defines paint operation parameters BeginBufferedPaint function.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_PAINTPARAMS.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_PAINTPARAMS.dwFlags
member.summary: One or more of the following values. BPPF_ERASE: Initialize the buffer to ARGB = {0, 0, 0, 0} during BeginBufferedPaint. BPPF_NOCLIP: Do not apply the clip region of the target device context (DC) to the double buffer. If this flag is not set and if the target DC is a window DC, then clipping due to overlapping windows is applied to the double buffer. BPPF_NONCLIENT: A non-client DC is being used.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_PAINTPARAMS.prcExclude
member.summary: Pointer to exclusion RECT structure. This rectangle is excluded from the clipping region. May be NULL for no exclusion rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.BP_PAINTPARAMS.pBlendFunction
member.summary: Pointer to BLENDFUNCTION structure, which controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps. If NULL, the source buffer is copied to the destination with no blending.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.GMEM_FIXED
member.summary: Allocates fixed memory. The return value is a pointer.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.GMEM_MOVEABLE
member.summary: Allocates movable memory. Memory blocks are never moved in physical memory, but they can be moved within the default heap.
member.remarks: The return value is a handle to the memory object. To translate the handle into a pointer, use the GlobalLock function. This value cannot be combined with GMEM_FIXED.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.GMEM_ZEROINIT
member.summary: Initializes memory contents to zero.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.GHND
member.summary: Combines GMEM_MOVEABLE and GMEM_ZEROINIT.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.GPTR
member.summary: Combines GMEM_FIXED and GMEM_ZEROINIT.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.WndProc

member.param: Handle to the window.
Specifies the message.
Specifies additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the parameter.

member.summary:
Register a window message for notify the control not lost focus.
Set the LParam of this message to Not zero to notify window to prevent all focus message (WM_SETFOCUS, WM_KILLFOCUS)

member.summary: Specifies the structure size, in bytes.

member.summary: Specifies the right margin, in units equal to the average character width.

member.name: F:C1.Framework.Platform.NativeMethods.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.LengthDrawn
member.summary: Receives the number of characters processed by DrawTextEx, including white-space characters. The number can be the length of the string or the index of the first line that falls below the drawing area. Note that DrawTextEx always processes the entire string if the DT_NOCLIP formatting flag is specified.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.OpenClipboard(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The OpenClipboard function opens the clipboard for examination and prevents other applications from modifying the clipboard content.
member.param: Handle to the window to be associated with the open clipboard. If this parameter is NULL, the open clipboard is associated with the current task.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.CloseClipboard
member.summary: The CloseClipboard function closes the clipboard.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.EmptyClipboard
member.summary: The EmptyClipboard function empties the clipboard and frees handles to data in the clipboard. The function then assigns ownership of the clipboard to the window that currently has the clipboard open.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.SetClipboardData(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SetClipboardData function places data on the clipboard in a specified clipboard format.
member.param: Specifies a clipboard format. This parameter can be a registered format or any of the standard clipboard formats.

Handle to the data in the specified format. This parameter can be NULL, indicating that the window provides data in the specified clipboard format (renders the format) upon request. If a window delays rendering, it must process the WM_RENDERFORMAT and WM_RENDERALLFORMATS messages.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the data. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.IsClipboardFormatAvailable(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The IsClipboardFormatAvailable function determines whether the clipboard contains data in the specified format.
member.param: Specifies a standard or registered clipboard format.
member.returns: If the clipboard format is available, the return value is nonzero. If the clipboard format is not available, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GetClipboardData(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The GetClipboardData function retrieves data from the clipboard in a specified format. The clipboard must have been opened previously.
member.param: Specifies a clipboard format.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to a clipboard object in the specified format. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.SetClipboardViewer(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SetClipboardViewer function adds the specified window to the chain of clipboard viewers. Clipboard viewer windows receive a WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD message whenever the content of the clipboard changes.
member.param: Handle to the window to be added to the clipboard chain.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value identifies the next window in the clipboard viewer chain. If an error occurs or there are no other windows in the clipboard viewer chain, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GetCurrentThreadId
member.summary: Retrieves the thread identifier of the calling thread.
member.returns: The return value is the thread identifier of the calling thread.
member.remarks: Until the thread terminates, the thread identifier uniquely identifies the thread throughout the system.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.MultiByteToWideChar(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps a character string to a wide-character (Unicode) string. The character string mapped by this function is not necessarily from a multibyte character set.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.WideCharToMultiByte(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: maps a wide-character string to a new character string. The new character string is not necessarily from a multibyte character set.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GlobalAlloc(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The GlobalAlloc function allocates the specified number of bytes from the heap.
member.param: Memory allocation attributes.
Number of bytes to allocate.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the newly allocated memory object. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GlobalFree(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalFree function frees the specified global memory object and invalidates its handle.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NULL. If the function fails, the return value is equal to a handle to the global memory object.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GlobalLock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalLock function locks a global memory object and returns a pointer to the first byte of the object's memory block.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the first byte of the memory block. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GlobalUnlock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalUnlock function decrements the lock count associated with a memory object that was allocated with GMEM_MOVEABLE. This function has no effect on memory objects allocated with GMEM_FIXED.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the memory object is still locked after decrementing the lock count, the return value is a nonzero value. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:C1.Framework.Platform.UnsafeNativeMethods.GlobalSize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalSize function retrieves the current size of the specified global memory object, in bytes.
member.param: Handle to the global memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the size of the specified global memory object, in bytes. If the specified handle is not valid or if the object has been discarded, the return value is zero.

member.name: T:C1.Framework.Text.Lexicons.Lexicon
member.summary: Defines the Lexicon class.
member.remarks: Provides a tool, that can parse the key word form the text. Each key word take effecting by a IPattern interface, lexicon will try to find it by the order. The find is described by . You also can set the two kinds of relation ship: Repellency and Dependency. Repellency, make a pattern not take effecting, when a pattern has been matched. Dependency, make a pattern not take effecting, until a pattern has been matched.
